Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support as it only provides two polls conducted by Democratic firms to support the statement that a majority of Democrats in North Carolina agree with the election laws and voter ID.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the two polls conducted by Democratic firms accurately represent the views of all Democrats in North Carolina, which may not be the case.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the GOP-backed election bill and voter identification requirements in North Carolina were passed with strong Republican support and broad Democratic opposition, indicating that most Democrats did not agree with the laws.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the support shown in the polls, such as the wording of the questions or other factors that may have influenced the responses.
